overallSummary: Fabio Giglietto maintains a presence across three social media platforms: Mastodon, LinkedIn, and Bluesky. His content focuses on research related to social media analysis, disinformation, and computational social science. He leverages these platforms to share research findings, announce opportunities (jobs/PhD positions), and engage in discussions within his field. Overall, his LinkedIn profile has the largest follower base, while Bluesky shows high engagement in terms of reposts.

contentThemes.description: Focuses on sharing research papers, methodologies, and discussions related to computational social science.
Content related to detecting, analyzing, and combating disinformation campaigns on social media.
Announcements of job openings, postdoctoral positions, and PhD opportunities within the research team.
Information about the release of new tools or software for social media analysis.

recommendations: Cross-promote content across platforms to maximize reach. For instance, share LinkedIn job postings on Bluesky and Mastodon.
Encourage audience participation by asking direct questions in posts to increase comments and replies.
Use relevant hashtags on all platforms to improve content discoverability. Use platform specific hashtags and conventions.
Share visualizations or summaries of research findings to make the content more accessible to a wider audience.

platformInsights.bluesky: Bluesky demonstrates strong repost activity, indicating a highly engaged audience within the research community. Further leverage this platform for quick research updates and open discussions.
platformInsights.mastodon: Mastodon has a more niche audience within the AOIR community. Use this platform for community specific discussions and sharing content related to open-source tools.
platformInsights.linkedin: LinkedIn has the largest follower base and generates the highest like and comment engagement, suggesting this is the primary platform for professional networking and announcing career opportunities and grant wins.

topPerformingContent.content: Excited to announce that our research team has been awarded a new grant to study information operations across social media platforms.
